message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.CY, cs.CL, cs.SOC. 

This paper examines the growth and survival of hashtags during the 2012 U.S. presidential debates, which falls under the category of social media analysis. The proposed framework of "conversational vibrancy" also suggests a focus on social dynamics. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), followed by cs.SD (Software Engineering), as the paper also discusses the statistical analysis of hashtag growth and persistence. Other possible sub-categories include cs.CY (Computers and Society), cs.CL (Computation and Language), and cs.SOC (Social and Economic Networks), as the paper touches on language evolution, social influence, and collective action in social media.
